result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah N. Solis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of synthetic cannabinoid - 2nd+ offense [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(em).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Isaiah N. Solis in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Defendant Isaiah N. Solis in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CM381 and 15CF62.

9:58 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CM381:
Count 1 - No contest

15CF62
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 14CM381 and Count 1 & 4 on 15CF62 and Counts 2 & 3 on 15CF62 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make any statements prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
14CM381:
Count 1 - 
Withheld sentence
Place on probation for 24 months
Serve 23 days in county jail - given 23 days jail credit for time served **this condition is satisfied
Pay costs to include the DNA surcharge
Pay restitution of $170.41 to Gerald Firkus
Aoda assessment and comply with recommendations
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

15CF62:
Count 1 -
Withheld sentence
Placed on Probation for 24 months to run concurrent to any other probation cases
Comply with conditions on 14CM381
Pay costs to include DNA surcharge

Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI 

Count 4 -
Withheld sentence
Placed on probation for 24 months to run concurrent to 14CM381 and Count 1 of 15CF62
Comply with condtions on 14CM381 and Count 1 of 15CF61
Pay costs to include DNA Surcharge
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Isaiah N. Solis in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Defendant Isaiah N. Solis in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:20 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

PRELIMINARY HEARING:
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

ARRAIGNMENT:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Bond Continued.
